DOC.brief_summary: Intimate partner violence ( IPV ) , include violence date relationship ( date violence , DV ) widespread serious public health problem . Among U.S. female IPV survivor , 47.1 % report first abusive relationship occur college age ( age 18-24 ) . Similarly , national survey , adult respondent 18-24 year age report high rate stalk victimization , commonly former intimate partner . Safety plan widely use intervention prevent respond IPV , yet vast majority abuse woman never access safety planning service . Our challenge increase college woman 's access safety planning , opportunity consider unique safety priority level danger end abusive relationship . In addition , `` bystander '' intervention train peer safely intervene show effective sexual assault prevention campus , college woman abusive relationship frequently disclose IPV friend , similar intervention test friend IPV response campus . Therefore , objective study evaluate : 1. effectiveness interactive , personalize smart phone web base safety application ( `` App '' ) intervention Maryland Oregon : 1 ) college woman ( age 18-24 ) experience IPV 2 ) friend ( age 18-24 ) woman experience IPV . The safety decision App allow user enter information : ) relationship health ; b ) safety priority ; c ) severity violence/danger relationship . The App use information provide user personalize safety plan information resource ; 2. dissemination App expand four state ( Arizona , Maryland , Missouri , Oregon ) determine reach , adoption , implementation maintenance App use among university/college student .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Safety App Respond Dating Violence College Women Their Friends
